You didn't mention it, but based on your specs, I assume you're running Windows 10. This issue may be caused by the Windows Game Bar and the *Game DVR* feature. I strongly recommend running through [**these steps**](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) in order to disable those features, in case they were exacerbating or causing the symptoms in the first place.

I hope this resolves it!

I had the same problem, but after I read this i started thinking. The rioter i think is aiming in the right area, but not at the right issue. On the latest Windows 10 update they added a few extras into their OS for Xbox gaming. I already had the Windows game bar and the Game DVR feature turned off, BUT there is now a third feature in that settings category called Game Mode. I had enabled that because it said it will help play games at the best performance possible. I disabled that feature and now the low fps issues is gone. So, i do believe that's what the problem is. maybe not for all summoners having this problem, but for most on Windows 10 OS.

IMPORTANT EDIT:
Found the fix to the problem by browsing the forums. I do believe there is some issue on Riot's end regarding this that needs to be looked into, but here's a temporary fix for anybody else experiencing this problem.

1)Run league in custom game. 
2)Alt tab
3)open up task manager.
4) right click "League of Legends client" (probably will be the highest usage program at the top of the list)
5) select properties
6) select compatibility tab
7) under compatibility mode check the "run this program in compatibility mode for"
8) select "Windows 7" in the drop down menu. 
9) Hit Apply and then OK
10) Changes will not take effect until you reload the client. Exit the game and start a new custom game, FPS problem should be fixed.
--------
